note.desc: Possibly diring the time of King Lebnä Dǝngǝl (r. 1508-40), re-established late 17th or early 18th cent. Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, the late 17th - early 18th-cent. head of Gundä Gunde, played a role in the establishement of the local monastic community.
note.ab: Gädam. Some 10 monks were residing in the monastery at the time of the visit. Tābots: said to be "44", i.e. very many, both wooden and marble; specifically were mentioned tabots of Trinity, Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, Michael, Mädḫane ʿAläm, Mary.

22 Mss. photographed: GKM-001 "The Spiritual Elder"; GKM-002 "Miracles of Mary"; GKM-003 "The Book of the Chants"; GKM-004 "Miracles of Mary"; GKM-005 "Four Gospels"; GKM-006 "The Rite of the Holy Week"; GKM-007 "Homily of the Living One"; GKM-008 "Pauline Epistles"; GKM-009 "Synaxarion (September)"; GKM-010 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; GKM-011 "Synaxarion (March)"; GKM-012 "Miracles of Mikaʾel"; GKM-013 "Vita of Mäzgäbä Śǝllase"; GKM-014 "Psalter"; GKM-015 "Prayer of Incense"; GKM-016 "Miracles of Jesus"; GKM-017 "The Covenant of Mary"; GKM-018 "Psalter"; GKM-019 "Collection of Maryam Texts and hymns"; GKM-020 "Prayers of Mary"; GKM-021 "The Book of the Baptismal Rite; The Book of the Baptismal Rite"; GKM-022 fragments of a Missal and a Psalter.
